title: How to View Your Wi-Fi Password on iPhone: The Complete Guide

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings app. If you want to find the Wi-Fi password for the network you're connected to right now, you can easily do so in your settings.

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi . It's near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap the Info button next to your current Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Tap the Info button next to your current Wi-Fi network. It's the small blue "i" in a circle.

steps.title: Tap the Password field to reveal the password.
steps.content: Tap the Password field to reveal the password. You will be prompted to enter your PIN or passcode or to use a biometric like Face ID or Touch ID. Want to share the password with someone? Tap Copy above the password to copy it to your clipboard, which makes it easy to paste into a text message or email.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings app. If you need to find a Wi-Fi password for a network you've connected to in the past, you can easily do this in your settings as well.

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi . It's near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Edit at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap Edit at the top-right corner. You'll be prompted to enter a PIN, password, or biometric to continue.

steps.title: Tap the Info button next to any Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Tap the Info button next to any Wi-Fi network. It's the small blue "i" in a circle.

steps.title: Tap the Password field to reveal the password.
steps.content: Tap the Password field to reveal the password. The password for the selected network will now appear. If you want to share the Wi-Fi password with someone, just tap Copy above the password. You can then easily paste it into a text, email, or instant message.

steps.title: Open the Passwords app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Passwords app on your iPhone. If you're using iOS 18 or later, you can find any saved Wi-Fi passwords in the new Passwords app. The Passwords app also makes it easy to share a saved Wi-Fi password with others quickly. When you open the app, you'll be prompted to use a biometric (like Face ID or Touch ID) or enter a PIN or password to continue.

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi . It's one of the tiles at the top of the Passwords app. This displays a list of all saved Wi-Fi networks and their associated passwords.

steps.title: Tap a network.
steps.content: Tap a network. This displays information about the saved Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Tap the password field to view the password.
steps.content: Tap the password field to view the password. This displays the password in clear text.

steps.title: Share the password with others.
steps.content: Share the password with others. If someone needs the password, there's an easy sharing tool built in. Here's how to use it: Tap the password to bring up the menu. Tap Shareâ€¦ Select a sharing method, such as the Messages app to share via text or AirDrop to send the password to someone nearby.

steps.title: Get your router's IP address.
steps.content: Get your router's IP address. If you can't use the previous methods because you're using an older iPhone, or the password you've saved is incorrect, you can find the Wi-Fi password by logging in to your Wi-Fi router as an admin. You will need to have the admin password for the router to do this, and you'll need to be already connected to the Wi-Fi network. To get your router's IP address: Open your iPhone's Settings. Tap Wi-Fi . Tap the Info icon on the network. Find the router's IP address next to "Router." Copy to copy the IP address.

steps.title: Paste the router's IP address into your browser's address bar.
steps.content: Paste the router's IP address into your browser's address bar. You can use any web browser on your phone, like Safari or Chrome. You may need to press the Go key to continue. If you see a page that warns you that the connection isn't private, go to Advanced > Proceed .

steps.title: Sign into your router.
steps.content: Sign into your router. The username and password here are different from what you use for the Wi-Fi network, but you should be able to find them printed on your router, usually on a sticker on the bottom or back. The most common usernames are "admin" or "user," while most default passwords are "password" or "admin". You can also use this helpful guide to find your router password. If you've changed the default router password and don't remember what you've changed it to, you might consider resetting the router .

steps.title: Go to the router's Wi-Fi settings.
steps.content: Go to the router's Wi-Fi settings. Each manufacturer, like Netgear or Linksys, has a different page setup, so you'll need to browse around a little. You should be able to find your Wi-Fi network name under "Wireless" in a menu.

steps.title: Locate the password.
steps.content: Locate the password. Once you find where your Wi-Fi settings are, you should see "Network Name (SSID)" and "Password." If you want to change the password, you can tap in the "Password" field to do so. Remember to tap Save if you've changed the password.

steps.title: Make sure iCloud Keychain is enabled on your iPhone and Mac.
steps.content: Make sure iCloud Keychain is enabled on your iPhone and Mac. As long as you're using the same Apple Account on your iPhone and your Mac (and you haven't turned off Keychain), you can see saved Wi-Fi passwords and other passwords from your iPhone when you're on your Mac. Here's how to make sure this feature is enabled: [1] X Research source On your iPhone: Open Settings , tap your name, and select iCloud . Tap Passwords under "Saved to iCloud." Tap Sync this iPhone to turn on iCloud Passwords & Keychain if not already turned on. On your Mac: Open the Apple menu and select System Settings . Click your name and then select iCloud . Click Passwords . Click Sync this Mac and then Done . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Passwords app on your Mac.
steps.content: Open the Passwords app on your Mac. You'll find the Passwords app in your Applications list. When prompted, use Touch ID or enter your account password to continue.

steps.title: Click Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Click Wi-Fi . This displays a list of all Wi-Fi passwords you've saved on your Mac, and any Wi-Fi passwords you've synced to iCloud from other devices. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Click a Wi-Fi network. If you've saved a Wi-Fi password on your iPhone, you should now see it in the Wi-Fi section of your Passwords app.

steps.title: Click the Wi-Fi password to view it.
steps.content: Click the Wi-Fi password to view it. You may be prompted to enter your password or use Touch ID again. The password will then display in clear text.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. If you created a Wi-Fi hotspot on your phone, you can easily pull up the password to share it with others.

steps.title: Tap Personal Hotspot.
steps.content: Tap Personal Hotspot . It's near the top of the Settings app.

steps.title: Find the password next to "Wi-Fi Password."
steps.content: Find the password next to "Wi-Fi Password." As long as "Allow Others to Join" is toggled on, you can provide others with this Wi-Fi password so they can use your iPhone as a Wi-Fi hotspot.
